result.execSummary:
The defendant Sasha S Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. (fine/costs have been paid in full)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sasha S Brown

records.addlTxt: 12:00 PM Defendant Sasha S Brown in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  State has received nothing from defendant regarding completion of any of the conditions of the deferred agreement.  State moves to amend charge to a County Ordinance Disorderly Conduct, recommends fine/costs in which defendant has already paid.  Clerk swears defendant. Court questions defendant on community service hours completed, no further law violations.  Court accepts State's oral motion to amend charge, finds defendant guilty of a County Ordinance of Disorderly Conduct.  Bond is no longer in effect.
Defendant paid $735.50 vis credit card at 11:55 am.

Deferred Judgment Agreement

Defendant Sasha S Brown in court with attorney Kimberly Zhang.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters no contest pleas to Ct. 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, withholds acceptance of plea on Ct. 1, reviews conditions contained with DJA, approves DJA.  Upon successful completion of DJA, State indicates matter can by disposed by written stipulation and defendant won't need to appear for next hearing.  Bond remains in effect.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 8, 2019 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Sasha S Brown in court with attorney Kimberly Zhang.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file.  Atty Nordin indicates defendant is accepting the State's offer, advises victim was not given notice that matter would be resolving today.  Court feels victim needs to have notice before proceeding. Counsel feel comfortable removing jury trial from the calendar. Court removes JT from the calendar, sets a plea/sentencing date. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 9, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on January 9, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 18, 2017 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Sasha S Brown in court with attorney Kimberly Zhang. Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions status. Defense advises that offer has been received but have been unable to come to resolution, requests that case be set for trial and pre-trial. Bond continues as is.

Defendant Sasha S Brown and attorney Kimberly Zhang appear by phone.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Zhang indicates she's received discovery but has not received an offer from the State. State will extend an offer to defendant as soon as possible, requests another status. Court will allow Atty Zhang and defendant appear by phone for next hearing if matter is not resolved. If matter is resolved, parties will need to be in court in person.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
Defense Discovery Demand

Defendant's request to appear by phone.
Court approves phone appearance.  The number to call to reach the court is 920-746-2204.

Defendant Sasha S Brown appears by phone along with attorney Tara L. Teesch who appears in person.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Teesch indicates she has a conflict in representing defendant, will have PD office appoint new counsel. Defendant needs to appear in person for next hearing unless new counsel would make the request for phone appearance.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Emails between Atty Teesch and JA Ripp re: phone appearance for defendant.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Sasha S Brown in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense enters not guilty plea, requests another status with the hopes of resolving the matter. State has no objection to adjournment. Court finds probable cause for bindover. If matter is not resolved on 7/31/17, defendant can appear by phone. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for July 31, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 4/12/17.

Defendant Sasha S Brown in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense requests another status in 30 days. If matter isn't resolved by next hearing, court grants phone appearance for defendant. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 19, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Sasha S Brown appears by video along with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne who appears by phone.  Defendant Sasha S Brown in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, finds probable cause. Court questions defendant on address/employment. Atty Heyne requests court set balance of initial appearance so he can review the complaint before proceeding. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 17, 2017 at 10:00 am.
